testcase.brief: Lan ports work with trunk mode, check allowed vlan
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
Pc1 connect to switch2 Laptop1 connect to lan port eth4 Switch2 connect to lan port eth1 Pc1 connect to switch2 Lan ports work with trunk mode
Test Procedure:
1. Configure mgt0.1 vlan 10, enable dhcp/dns server, ip-pool is 10.10.10.10-10.10.10.99 Configure mgt0.2 vlan20, enable dhcp/dns server, ip-pool is 20.20.20.20-20.20.20.99 2. Connect pc1 to lan port eth1, laptop1 to lan port eth4, check ip address of pc1, laptop1 Result1 3. Configure lan port eth1 native-vlan 10, allowed-vlan 20 4. Configure lan port eth4 native-vlan 20 5. check vlan-table. Result2 6. PC1 send packet with vlan tag 10 to laptop2 Result3
7. Pc1 send packet with vlan tag 20 to laptop2 Result4
8. Pc1 send packet with vlan tag 30 to laptop2 Result5
9. add an allowed-vlan 30 for lan port eth1
10. pc1 send packet with vlan tag 30 to laptop2 Result6

step.desc: 1. Enable mgt0 dhcp/dns server
2. Lan port works with trunk mode, check lan ports mode, vlan ID.
show port-config
show lan vlan-table
show interface
3. Check allowed vlan list, vlan-id-check flag
4. Laptop1 connect to lan ports, such as eth2, check HW ARL table (mac-table),Check laptop ip.
get raw mac of vpc2
get mac of br1.vpc2
step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")

step.desc: set br1.vpc2.tif.ip var for vpc2 on BR side
Laptop1 send a packet to mgt0 successfully
5. mac-table has an entry for laptop1, indicates port id, laptop mac address
step.telnet: -v "show interface eth2 mac-learning all" -v "show lan mac-table"

step.desc: 5. Check laptop ip . Result4
step.script: if [ "${br1.mgt0.prefix}" == "${br1.vpc2.prefix}" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi

step.desc: 6. Configure mgt0 native-vlan as br1.vpc2.vlan
7. Check lan ports native-vlan
lan ports native vlan is 10 mapped from mgt0’s native vlan
8. Configure mgt0.1 vlan 10, enable dhcp, dns server, configure ip address, ip-pool
step.telnet: -v "no interface mgt0 vlan" -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0.1 dns-server enable"

step.desc: tmp step
9. Laptop1 connect to eth2, check laptop1 ip address
set br1.vpc2.tif.ip var for vpc2 on BR side
laptop1 ip address is assigned by mgt0.1 dhcp server
step.script: if [ "${br1.mgt0.1.prefix}" == "${br1.vpc2.prefix}" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi

step.desc: 10. Configure eth2 native-vlan 20
8. Configure mgt0.2 vlan 20, enable dhcp, dns server, configure ip address, ip-pool
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.2 vlan ${br1.vpc3.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.2 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0.2 dns-server enable"

step.desc: 12. Check lan port eth2 native-vlan
lan port eth2 native-vlan is 20, an ports eth1/eth3/eth4 native-vlan is 1
tmp2 step
Laptop2 connect to eth2, check laptop2 ip address
set br1.vpc3.tif.ip var for vpc3 on BR side
laptop2 ip address is assigned by mgt0.2 dhcp server
step.script: if [ "${br1.mgt0.2.prefix}" == "${br1.vpc3.prefix}" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi
